snippet: As the survivors of Nazi brutality become ever older, an effort to have Germany spend more on in-home care for them has taken on a new urgency.
abstract: German Finance Ministry is working with Conference on Jewish Material Claims Against Germany to ensure poorest and weakest Holocaust survivors receive intensive care needed to live out final years at home; conference cares for some 55,000 survivors through reparations programs; need has taken on new urgency as many survivors are 80 or older and have increased special care needs linked to surviving harrowing experiences.
lead_paragraph: As the survivors of Nazi brutality become ever older, an effort to have Germany spend more on in-home care for them has taken on a new urgency.

headline.main: As Holocaust Becomes More Distant, Survivors’ Needs Intensify
headline.print_headline: Holocaust Survivors’ Needs Become Acute With Age
